website_summaries.verdict: This well-priced, lightweight rain jacket is great for travel.
pros: Includes a hood to keep your hair dry in wet weather
Thin material makes it compress well for travel
Jacket stands up to daily use
Does a great job of keeping you dry with adjustable wrist closures and a zipper protector
cons: May feel tight for those who are smaller on top and wider at the hips

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: This jacket is a great value. I bought it specifically for Iceland as an outer shell and it surpassed my expectations. It was both wind and waterproof. The wind proof came in handy as there were 30 mph winds with gusts up to 70 mph. I brought 3 rain jackets with me and this one was my favorite since it's wind and water proof she dried very quickly. The red is also a flattering and bright color. For reference I am 5'3 145 pounds and used a small. In my attached images I was able to wear a fleece jacket underneath for warmth.
customer_reviews.author: WONDERFULONE

customer_reviews.title: and does the job--a perfect windbreaker and rain jacket
customer_reviews.text: At first I bought a large (I am 5" 6', 165 lbs). I usually wear between a medium and a large, and I saw some reviews recommending to order a size up. I received the large very quickly, but it was way too big, so I returned it and purchased a medium. The medium came within just a few days of ordering! It fits perfectly, and does the job--a perfect windbreaker and rain jacket! I love Columbia--great quality and great service!
customer_reviews.author: Allie

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I bought an Acadia jacket 6 months ago directly from the Columbia site and loved it, so I just ordered another one but this time from Amazon. This one was clearly different from the original. Different fabric, no elastic at the cuff, the Columbia logo was not embroidered, and several other small differences. I am returning this because the quality is not nearly as good as the original.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy Leeber

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly low quality
customer_reviews.text: I am beyond disappointed with this. I bought a Columbia jacket expecting it to be of great quality, but this weekend, I found a gaping hole in it, not even along a seam. I purchased this on October 17th 2018, and found the hole on November 23rd. Unfortunately, the return window closed on November 16th, otherwise I would have returned it for a refund. I can’t believe I paid just almost $53 to only wear this a handful of times. This is the last time I buy Columbia products from Amazon since they gave me less than the standard 60 day return window.
customer_reviews.author: CEPhotog

customer_reviews.title: Definitely Buyer Beware!
customer_reviews.text: Let me begin by saying I read the reviews and bought this anyway, MY MISTAKE!! This is nowhere near a Columbia jacket, it is a cheap Chinese knock off. The fabric is cheap, the sleeves were 5 inches longer then my arms, the hood did not detach, I could go on. I did my homework before returning it just to make sure it wasn't supposed to be like that. I went to a local retail store, found the exact same jacket, it was the quality this one should have been and less expensive to boot. Thank goodness Amazon took it back.
customer_reviews.author: Janis M.

customer_reviews.title: Waterproof Excellence; Size Up for Better Fit Over Sweaters
customer_reviews.text: I own this rain jacket, which keeps me bone dry in the daily Florida downpours. So I bought another for my size M daughter who lives in Seattle. But she said it's too tight with a sweater underneath, and the rainy winters are also cold--so I returned it for a *men's* medium, which fit perfectly over her fleece sweater. Waterproof is worth every penny, just make sure you're also warm underneath--which may mean a bigger size since your perfect size won't fit comfortably over a bulky sweater.
customer_reviews.author: InOrlando

customer_reviews.title: pleased with the jacket
customer_reviews.text: Is a little loose but doesn't look too big. Will keep & can layer clothes. I appreciate the reviews that mentioned height & size: I'm 5-foot & weight 164 (much to my dismay). I considered the XL but at the time I bought this jacket the 1X was less expensive. Also the sleeve length is ok--a bit long for me but not ridiculously too long. The cuff comes with adjustable Velcro. The front also has Velcro to use when you don't want to zip up. I'm pleased with the jacket. The hood is a decent size, covers good in rain.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn D

customer_reviews.title: Great jacket!
customer_reviews.text: I finally bit the bullet and got myself a proper rain jacket. The fit was perfect. I'm 5'6 and 210 pounds and I got a 1X (plus, not XL). I haven't worn it in the rain yet though, but I'm planning on it. I would love to buy another color but the black was the cheapest. If they could make all the colors the same price that would be amazing! Haha wishful thinking though. Just buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Kamille Chavez

customer_reviews.title: Great light weight, actually waterproof shell
customer_reviews.text: Flattering fit in a basic rain shell that can double as a light jacket or windbreaker. No insulation. Just a shell for going over something warmer, or for warmer weather. I absolutely love this brand. I'm fairly tall, and many brands make the larger sizes to fit more bulk on an average frame, but this brand actually fits a good size frame. Maybe not if you are six foot, as my niece tried it on, but for someone over 5' 8" the arms are long enough and have range of motion for broad shoulders. It's synthetic, so there is a little rustling, but it's so comfortable and flattering that I got more than one color.
customer_reviews.author: FJMShopper

customer_reviews.title: I'm 5'2 170. Got a large.
customer_reviews.text: I'm 5'2 170. Im a C cup and this fit just right around my chest. Little loose around my belly and I tightened the pull string around the bottom but that part was a little loose as well. I probably could fit in a medium but it would be snug around the chest so I think large was a good way to go. This is my second Columbia rain jacket. I just love them. It's very light weight. Good summer rain jacket.
customer_reviews.author: Broke and Bougie

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for morning walk
customer_reviews.text: I was on the fence about ordering, some of the reviews had size issues around the waist, nock/hood and arm holes-all thing that are my concerns. Ordered anyway and glad I did, this jacket fit perfectly! None of those issues for me! The only thing I wish is had was a inside/hidden pocket. But overall I am happy with this jacket! Wore this on my 3 mile walk this morning, light rain and mist with mid/high 60s. Perfect!
customer_reviews.author: melissa morales

customer_reviews.title: Perfect rain jacket
customer_reviews.text: I recently got this rain jacket for all the soaking we've been getting in NorCal. My husband (his Amazon account) has a Columbia rain jacket and I really liked it and looked for a women's version. Found this and although it's not pack-able as advertised, it is def a great jacket. The medium is large enough to wear a sweatshirt under without being tight. For context, I'm 5'2", have no idea how much I weigh (who needs that stress) and usually wear medium sized tops. This jacket works well for my rain needs and maybe as a windbreaker. :)
customer_reviews.author: Dan Fellows

customer_reviews.title: This is just too small.
customer_reviews.text: This is just too small. My current jacket is a 2X and still fits me. I was replacing it because it has a hole in it and Columbia makes good clothes. This jacket was like wearing a cheap parka and it's too small at 3X. Not even just slightly too small. Really too small. I had to check the tag to see what size it was. Arms were too short and I felt like it was going to rip. No thanks. I should've ordered from Lands End.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Glenn

customer_reviews.title: Itchy - Itchy - Itchy
customer_reviews.text: Itchy, itchy, itchy. It looked nice and the Large fit a 12/14 very nicely. But it ITCHED even when worn under a long sleeve shirt. Had a slight oily smell too. Will have to return as makes me miserable to put it on for even a couple of minutes. Glad I tried it around the house before taking it out into the world or risking the return time.
customer_reviews.author: West Coast Dreamer

customer_reviews.title: Great Jacket!
customer_reviews.text: At first the price kept me from ordering, but it has turned out to be a great jacket and worth the price. Sometimes I have to order up 1 size, but this fit just right! (5'4", 175 lbs, pear shaped female!) The mesh lining makes this jacket very comfortable. It is breathable, but repels rain really well!
customer_reviews.author: lmatty

customer_reviews.title: Ordered up 1 size just in case. Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Was concerned at first bc a lot of reviews said sleeves were snug so I ordered a size up. I usually wear an XL or 1X top, I don’t like anything snug or fitted especially coats or jackets. I like to have room to layer if necessary and be comfortable. Ordered a 2x based on reviews. Sleeves are fine and still plenty of room if I want to layer or have on a sweater during winter but it’s light weight and perfect for summertime hurricane season as well.
customer_reviews.author: Bridget

customer_reviews.title: It fit great. I know I was on the fence because ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this last minute for a mothers day trip to NYC that we realized it last minute was going to be chilly and pour on us. It fit great. I know I was on the fence because of some of the reviews but I am so glad I got it. It fit perfect everywhere. I am 5'6" 215lbs, a little busty, and had no problems. Wore a thin long sleeve shirt under it and it was perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Genuine or.. ?
customer_reviews.text: I usually wear a size 10 and have 36D bust. The medium fits perfect except only slightly tight at the hip (this jacket does hit the hip for average height I am 5'5" tall) It did not get 5 stars because I feel the quality is off , for what I've come to expect from Columbia ,and from what is displayed in the listing photographs. Logo is not embroidered but screen printed ..drawstrings are subpar.. and Velcro I could do without. Zipper pole and details etc. Just seemed off. It went back.
customer_reviews.author: Bianxx

customer_reviews.title: A Quality Rain Jacket
customer_reviews.text: I really like the weight of this rain jacket with a hood. The color I ordered is very pretty as well. It is a very nice rain jacket.
customer_reviews.author: Texas Girl

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for light to moderate rain. Breathable mesh inside. Nice sized hood. Velcro fasteners at wrists and neck to tighten as needed. I tried on a medium at a sporting good store and it fit good in the arms and shoulders, but was tight across the chest and hips. The large fits perfectly. ( I wear a 12-14 in women's ). It looks exactly as pictured. Very pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: lyndaB

customer_reviews.title: I love this raincoat
customer_reviews.text: I love this raincoat! Exactly what I needed. I'm 5'5", 135lbs, slim in the waist but large-chested, and I ordered a Medium. It's roomy enough to layer with a pretty substantial fleece for chilly weather, and the sleeves slightly cover my hands...which is exactly my preference. I recommend sizing down if you like a slimmer fit. Great price, came less than 24 hours after ordering last-minute for a trip to Seattle. Couldn't believe it when I realized I didn't own a raincoat anymore, but that's living in LA for you. I'm happy that now I'll have this one around for trips out of town and the occasional rainstorm (I still don't own an umbrella).
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Not good.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my Columbia rain jacket I lost on a trip. This one was way different. It was heavy, rubbery material and fit very poorly. This is more like a Coleman jacket. Not up to my standards for light weight camping gear. Not worth the money. Its going back.
customer_reviews.author: Korinne Lassiter

customer_reviews.title: Great waterproof jacket
customer_reviews.text: Just wore it for the first big storm for about three hours in down pouring rain. As a mail carrier, this jacket is amazing. Completely waterproof.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Needs more room at the hip
customer_reviews.text: I really loved this jacket and wanted it to work. For reference, I normally wear a large on top and my pant size is a 12/14. I ordered the large. However, the arms were super long--something I almost never experience as I am tall. The bust was fine, the waist okay but not a lot of extra room, and the hips... well, the hips are why I returned it. I could zip it and it looked cute, but if i sat down, it had to be unzipped. There is no give or generosity in the hip size. I have 43 inch hips and this coat was just too confining in the hip area.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I want my old jacket back
customer_reviews.text: My old Gore-Tex jacket finally went kaput much to my dismay. I usually wear a large shirt, but I got the extra large jacket and I'm glad I did. It fits without any pulling when I sit down in the car when it's fully zipped. There is alot of extra room if I need to wear a fleece jacket underneath. It's not as warm as my old jacket though and I don't like the crinkly plastic sound.
customer_reviews.author: MR

customer_reviews.title: Waterproof, fit is perfect
customer_reviews.text: I waited to write my review until after I wore my jacket in the rain. I walked in the rain and this is definitely waterproof. Fit was perfect. I like that I could make the hood tighter as it was windy. Also love the velcro at the wrists to make tighter or looser. Also at 5'3" this was right at the bottom of my butt!
customer_reviews.author: Karen V.

customer_reviews.title: Good rain jacket
customer_reviews.text: It's a rain jacket, so it does what it's supposed to do- it keeps you dry. I originally bought it for a trip to Yellowstone to roll up in my hiking backpack in case of rain, but I used it multiple times before the trip and was pleasantly surprised by how dry and warm I stayed when wearing it. Went out four-wheeling in a storm in Montana in 40-degree weather wearing this and my upper half was bone dry and I stayed decently warm. It's too large for me (ordered XS: 5'6" and 108 lbs), so if you're in-between sizes, definitely size down. Overall, it's a good rain jacket for the price. Columbia, you've done it again.
customer_reviews.author: Lyndoodles

customer_reviews.title: Perfect rain jacket
customer_reviews.text: I have had an issue finding a rain jacket that I like...that doesn't have a poly-something coating. This jacket fits perfectly. I love the color. It has finally warmed up here in WNY so that I had the chance to wear it out. Great jacket and very fair price.
customer_reviews.author: GHBRN

customer_reviews.title: True to size great with good details
customer_reviews.text: This was a great deal for a Columbian windbreaker. So I had to swoop on it. I'm in the east coast where its very humid and rains. It'll be 80-90° with humidity to match and be raining. I cannot wear a rain jacket without sweating. This is a great material for commuting and/or hiking and dealing with hot and wet weather. Roomy pockets with zippers so things don't fall out, adjustable hood and sleeves for the short people, the hood also has a very small extra visor sew on so your forehead stays fully covered. Would definitely buy again and in different colors.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Excellent...Good hood...important! Sizing a little small.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent. This jacket works well in the rain AND wind. Got this mainly to wear OVER my down parka and with my Columbia rain pants for my winter trip to Iceland. The pants are also perfect. I ordered a size up to go over the parka. Way too small even without the parka. Ordered another size up and now it’s perfect. Here’s the important part. The hood has a little brim on the front that deflects the water away from your face. I ordered a different brand that did not have that. That coat was excellent also but you REALLY need that brim otherwise the water just runs in your face. The brim puts this over the top for me.
customer_reviews.author: N. Ross

customer_reviews.title: Great jacket for spring and summer rains
customer_reviews.text: This jacket was perfect for what I bought it for- a trip to San Diego in the spring. I got stuck in a downpour while walking for two miles to Balboa Park, and my clothes were perfectly dry underneath. It’s lightweight and easy to pack. I ordered the turquoise color in a size small- for size reference, I’m 5’3, 130 lbs, 34C.
customer_reviews.author: Happychild17

customer_reviews.title: Quality waterproof jacket
customer_reviews.text: I love how the jacket is longer than most but not too long that it's uncomfortable or weird. At the very next morning after receiving this jacket it was raining and thunder storming. I must say that this jacket held up to all of my expectations. I enjoyed how the jacket does not stick to your skin when it gets wet on the outside. It's comfortable breathable and I like how you can adjust the waist and the hood and the cuffs. I will update this review if anything changes but if I don't then just know that this is a good quality waterproof rain jacket.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Bought it at my friend's recommendation
customer_reviews.text: My friend recommended this jacket after purchasing it for her whole family for a trip to Florida. It rained during her vacation so she was able to test it out thoroughly and gives her approval. I'm glad I listened to her as it became a staple rain jacket for me. It kept me dry (I didn't try just wearing this in heavy rain or storms) and it is actually quite windproof (which I didn't realized and sweated a lot during the warmer rainy season). It's comfortable, too. I liked it so much that I bought another one in another color.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy

customer_reviews.title: Ridiculous arms!!
customer_reviews.text: I should've believed the reviews. If you have actual skin on your arms, the sleeves will be too thin. Since I like to actually bend my arms at the elbow.. the jacket is being returned. It's almost comical how skinny the sleeves are!!
customer_reviews.author: Debbie

customer_reviews.title: To tight
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed in this Columbia rain jacket..this is my 2nd Columbia jacket I've bought this month that didnt fit.. I've also noticed the quality has went down.last year these same 2 products were sized right and were of good quality... this is thin, tapered through the waist, tight in the arms and you can not layer it, I am 16-18 and last yr a 2x swallowed me, so I bought a 1x and fit great. This year I went and bought a 1x and both fit like large. The tapered waist is so tight you can only wear it un zipped.i doubt I buy anything from Columbia again.
customer_reviews.author: J&P

customer_reviews.title: but that's what you want with a jacket like this. I live in AZ
customer_reviews.text: I would usually order a small in jackets - I ordered a small and it fit perfectly. The fit was loose, but that's what you want with a jacket like this. I live in AZ, so I didn't need a waterproof rain jacket, per se, I just needed a light windbreaker. This would have worked well for that purpose, but I could *not* get over how loud the crinkliness of this jacket was! It was like crumpling up wax paper any time I moved. I sent it back for that reason. However, if that doesn't bother you, then I'd HIGHLY recommend this jacket!
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Great light rain jacket
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a rain jacket that I could easily pack. This one is perfect. I have another gortex jacket for hard conditions in the outdoors. But the Columbia is really nice for around town and to pack for shorter hikes when it threatens to rain. I don't like how the hood fits. It's loose and difficult to adjust so when I turn my head either right or left the hood is hiding my view. This doesn't happen with more serious jackets, but I can put up with it because I didn't buy it to face difficult rain conditions for a long time. Perfect jacket for around town and definitely worth having at the price I paid.
customer_reviews.author: sycamore

customer_reviews.title: Best I've Owned
customer_reviews.text: I bought this jacket in anticipation of rain in wind. I wanted something not too heavy since I was going to be using it during the summer. I wore the jacket in the rain while hiking and it didn't make me too warm. When it was windy, the jacket held its own; I didn't feel the wind cut through me. As an added plus, it kept me warm during chilly mornings. I ordered a size larger than I normally wear so it was a little large on me, but I wanted it to be loose. This is the best rain/wind jacket I've ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: tnslp

customer_reviews.title: It has a nice mesh liner so the jacket won't stick to your ...
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for. This is a lightweight jacket to keep your clothes dry. It has a nice mesh liner so the jacket won't stick to your skin. I was worried about the size because many reviews said it runs small and to order up a size. I decided to order my regular size and it's perfect. Depending on the brand, I wear size 12 or 14. The large is just right. I even tried it on with a hoodie underneath and it was a bit snug in the hip area but not uncomfortably so. Plus, If it's chilly outside, I would just wear my lined jacket. This one isn't designed for cold weather.
customer_reviews.author: B. Bish

customer_reviews.title: Great Jacket
customer_reviews.text: I love this jacket. My Daughter has the same one an loves it as well. It's light weight but keeps you warm because it works like a windbreaker. It has Velcro adjustable sleeves so I can make them as snug as possible and the breeze doesn't go up the arm. I was unsure on the size so I went to Dicks Sporting Goods and tried it on. Dicks was $15 more expensive and had several colors in stock so I could actually see the jacket before purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: 1002falcon

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: This is a great Spring rain jacket, and looks exactly as pictured, although is a bit big. I ordered a medium and for reference, I am 5'6 150 lbs, and there is still plentyyyy of room for a sweater/sweatshirt underneath the jacket. The jacket is really light weight and comfortable, and is definitely rain weather approved! It does a great job of keeping me dry in this rainy transition to Spring. I probably could have gotten away with ordering a small, and will keep that in mind when I order another one once this one wears out.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Nice jacket for small people
customer_reviews.text: The jacket is very nice. I am 5’2” about 120lb and the small had plenty of room so it would still be good for layering. The hood actually goes over my head and folds up to keep the rain off your face. Sleeves can be tightened which works well for my short arms. It’s a nice jacket but I returned it for a different color. I just Wasn’t a fan of the white
customer_reviews.author: SLH

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking jacket-- very Classy in White!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in white, which looks very upscale on! Love the way it looks, but like the other one i ordered (Splash) a bit better. This one is a bit shorter, does not have a nice inside pocket, and the zipper only opens in one direction. The other jacket is better for me in these three ways. The only thing I actually dislike about this jacket is the Velcro (instead of snaps over the zipper.) The velcro drives me crazy... it constantly wants to fasten together when one is trying to zip or unzip the jacket. If you don't plan to zip up that much, however, the velcro will certainly make it fast to put on.
customer_reviews.author: kawh

customer_reviews.title: beautiful yellow, stays clean, runs large
customer_reviews.text: I live on 13 acres and a lot of what I do exposes me to full sun and lots of mosquitos and biting flies. I have a similar black Northface jacket, but it absorbs the sun and makes me so hot. The bright yellow protects me while still keeping me cool. Even when the temps are in the high 70s/low 80s, I don't get overheated. I wear it almost nightly when I walk my dogs. It keeps the mosquitos at bay. I have worn it so much while doing chores, some that can be dirty and dusty. It still looks brand new! I am very happy with the quality and appearance of this product!
customer_reviews.author: J. Kinzel

customer_reviews.title: Glad I chose this jacket
customer_reviews.text: Just got my jacket in the mail, and I already love it! I am 5'8 130lbs and although I'm generally a small in clothing, i decided to be safe and order a Medium. I'm glad I did because the arm sleeves fit perfect and the jacket has a great length to it. It creates a slim looking silhouette due to the color blocking on the outside and the inside lining feels soft against bare skin. It's comfortable without a jacket underneath, a hoodie could fit (probably a bit snug) under the jacket as well. I will be in Oregon this weekend, so I will check the waterproofing abilities then. Over all, I love this jacket! Definitely worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy

customer_reviews.title: I ordered size up
customer_reviews.text: I am 160lbs and 5'6 very curvy small chest x large fit perfectly with plenty of room for sweaters etc... I really like the functionality of the hood as well, doesn't hang over to the point where I can't see but hood covers enough to where I don't get wet, good design, I noticed Columbia runs small so I get x large in their clothing. I have big thighs and the jacket doesn't hug that region, fits nice and loose but not too bulky looking either. The sleeves have a Velcro options so sleeves can be more fitting or loose whatever you prefer.
customer_reviews.author: Ajoneil

customer_reviews.title: 5'7 180 lb lady fits just fine
customer_reviews.text: so im 5'7 usually large /xl tops jackets. bust is 36/38 c/d flexuates at times but this fits with some wiggle room. arm length is good its lightweitgh, its below the hips but well above thigh on me .see how tall i am. looks nice. hood is roomy but not over big which i can appreciate. i put a tee shirt and thin zip up sweat shirt under and still felt ok, but i wont be able to wear a bigger heavy sweatshirt and this is ok with me. so great jacket so far, waiting for another rain to go out in it! its a clean simple classic rain jacket.love it
customer_reviews.author: liz

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight & Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: This jacket fits exactly as expected. I am 5’5” and weigh 190 and the XL was perfect. It’s not snug and I still have room to wear a thick sweater or hoodie if I need to. It’s lightweight enough to put over a short sleeved shirt on a warm and rainy day. I really love this raincoat!
customer_reviews.author: Potterizer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic quality
customer_reviews.text: I had a "rain jacket" that caused me to seriously question if it actually was a rain jacket, since it completely soaked through whenever I wore it and it actually rained... I decided it was time to get a new one that would hopefully actually keep the rain out and would be perfect for hiking in as well. This rain jacket is fantastic and I would expect nothing less from Columbia! It fits great, has a hood with elastic around the edge, and you can change the size of the wrist holes. I also wore it while hiking in the snow and it kept me dry and warm. Really glad I purchased one!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Haven't worn it in the rain yet
customer_reviews.text: I really can't give a review as to how waterproof it is as it has not rained since I got it. It fits really nice and feels warm although there really isn't a lining in it. The hood seems rather large but it does have "pulls' on the sides to make it more snug. There are also Velcro at the sleeves to make them tighter and Velcro on the front of the jacket. All in all if it keeps me dry when it rains I love it and I love the blue color I got.
customer_reviews.author: Rose

customer_reviews.title: Perfect windbreaker
customer_reviews.text: This Columbia windbreaker is perfect for me. I wore it as a top layer on a trip to Iceland-it couldn't have performed better. Waterproof enough to suit my needs during rainy weather (but not necessarily a downpour). I re-treat with silicone spray if it gets supersoaked. Deep, zipper pockets are a bonus. I wear it Spring thru Autumn in Wisconsin, plus it is a staple when I travel; packs small and light. My only complaint is velcro closings are not my favorite, but that's just personal preference. I ordered a size larger than my usual to provide for plenty of layering room.
customer_reviews.author: C. Baltus

customer_reviews.title: Fits  Loose
customer_reviews.text: I really like this jacket and purchased a size up to accommodate a light sweater etc. under the jacket based upon others reviews. Unfortunately, for me a size up for this purpose was too large. I am 5'5" and usually a medium, I purchased the large. I would return however, I wore the jacket on a short vacation. When able I will purchase again, but get the medium size.
customer_reviews.author: TCD

customer_reviews.title: upper arms disproportionately small, but overall meets my need for a light weight rain jacket
customer_reviews.text: Pros mesh lining, two ample pockets that zip, sufficient arm length, roomy chest area, stylish lines with the two tone Watch-outs gets tight on hips if I put gloves in my pocket, fabric is noisy (not surprising for water proof), velcro to seal the zipper gets caught a lot Con The upper arm is too small for the rest of the sizing. I can wear it with a micro fleece on but I have to tug to get it off and arrange fabric wrinkles to get it on. Bottom line: It could be better, but it meets my needs
customer_reviews.author: Delaine S. Adkins

customer_reviews.title: Authentic Colombia Sportswear Jacket
customer_reviews.text: Authentic Columbia jacket. Haven’t had rain yet. But I’m a classic pear shape and fitting in the stomach/hips area is tricky. This fit perfectly. I can layer it with ease. The hood has a bill to it—hopefully rain will just pour off. I’m excited to try it out in the rain. Also, very packable.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Conger

customer_reviews.title: Light and well made
customer_reviews.text: Well made wind breaker with mesh lining. Its very light weight. The sleeves are too long for me and the end of the sleeve is much wider than my wrist - but there's a velcro strip to make adjustments. Also, I have a pear shape so jacket is a little snug at my hips. I bought crimson color which is a nice deep red and not bright at all. This is a very nice jacket.
customer_reviews.author: MsDebW

customer_reviews.title: Nice Raincoat
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a raincoat to wear in Seattle during the end of August/beginning of Sept. This is a great one! It's great quality and has done great for Seattle and beyond. It is a little warmer, not quite as breathable as I'd hoped, but I'm ok with that for the quality of it! Would absolutely buy again
customer_reviews.author: Holli

customer_reviews.title: Broken Zipper - Standard for Columbia
customer_reviews.text: I have had this jacket for less than a year. I bought it for a trip hiking in the alps and it worked well for that (compact, blocks wind and rain, good sized hood). I have only worn it about 10 times and I find the zipper is broken. It refused to nestle into its mechanism and finally, I got it in there and then it split below with no pressure. A windbreaker without a zipper is useless. I would like a replacement. But I would also like Columbia to stop using cheap zippers. Two of my sons had Columbia bugaboo ski jackets that had zippers that constantly split open. Columbia's zipper supplier needs to be replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Amy H

customer_reviews.title: Truly waterproof
customer_reviews.text: I already had a Columbia small and it was too tight to wear winter layers underneath. So I bought the medium size this time and it gave me just about the right space to close the zipper with 3 layers underneath. I am delighted to have the mesh layer to help with the body condensation. My other jacket didn’t have that. The nylon shell is just like my other jacket which has proven to be waterproof. I’m confident this one one will be equally so. The red color is beautifully vibrant.
customer_reviews.author: Dee Anna

customer_reviews.title: Nice, lightweight jacket
customer_reviews.text: I bought this over a year ago to replace my old lightweight jacket (wearing college apparel after graduating is kind of sad) and it does the trick. My biggest complaint is that this material is very noisy and makes crinkly noises when I move, but on the plus side it has a hood. As for stats, I'm 5'3" and around 110lbs with a slim build and the XS fits just fine. That said, I don't layer (get too hot too easily with layers) so you may want to size up if you plan to wear this over something bulkier than a t-shirt.
customer_reviews.author: Acire

customer_reviews.title: Rainy-weather gardening
customer_reviews.text: Just finished gardening in the rain; the jacket and matching pants worked beautifully. When I was done I just hosed off and hung the pieces to dry. Re: fit I bought 2X which is a bit large for me (size 16) but, on the other hand, I was able to wear pants and a double-layer of fleece under the rain gear. I'm 5'4" and the pants are 3" too long. I plan to duct tape the hem and also tape a little fold inside the hood so I can see better. A great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Paula Not from Gualala

customer_reviews.title: Stiff like a tarp
customer_reviews.text: Just received this and my first impression is...noisy! It is super crackly, like a lightweight tarp. It is nice and long, which I like, but a little tight in the chest area. The zipper is really delicate-it looks cheap and like it will not hold up. I need this for a trip, so I will try it and see if it is actually waterproof, as it claims, and how it functions overall. Based on other Columbia coats I have, it runs at least a 1/2 size too small overall, and a full size too small in the chest.
customer_reviews.author: C. Madden

customer_reviews.title: Fit is narrow
customer_reviews.text: I like the jacket a a lot. I usually wear a medium or small, but the medium of this jacket was decidedly snug at the hip with a sweatshirt underneath. So I bought a Large. As a result, it is roomy, a bit on the long side, coming to about upper thigh length. Sleeves are at least 5 inches too long, but no problem to fold them over. I may even get them shortened by a tailor. The hood is generous and there is a bit of overhang to keep rain off your face. Pocket interior is a mesh fabric, which is ok, but it could get caught on something like keys. Overall, I am very happy with the jacket.
customer_reviews.author: Nikola Jeschke

customer_reviews.title: Sent it back!
customer_reviews.text: Way too small and has no stretch, so I sent it back within 5 minutes of receiving it. I own multiple Columbia sportswear jackets and coats and I order the same size I wear and all of them and this one was way too small and because it has no stretch, there was no way it was going to work.
customer_reviews.author: SheriReho

customer_reviews.title: Great coat
customer_reviews.text: I indicated that it's somewhat large, although I don't think I need a smaller size. It's just a bit loose, which is good for a coat (I just don't wear big sweaters under it, so this could make a difference). I got the Large and I'm 5 7" and weigh about 140 pounds, wide shoulders too, so Large is the right size for me. Other than that - it's really nice and comfy, good quality and did a great job yesterday protecting me from a stormy wind and rain. Very happy with this purchase :)
customer_reviews.author: Hadas

customer_reviews.title: Cheap feel not Columbia standards from past.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to replace my Columbia jacket that my puppy chewed through the pocket for treats. I thought it would be the same but found that it was all netting inside, sleeves included. The grey color was more tan in color and it just felt cheap for the money. With the netting going all the way down, I could picture it snagging on everything in back pockets on jeans. Also , no elastic in cuffs, just Velcro . Really disappointed; sending back!
customer_reviews.author: Eileen

customer_reviews.title: Pockets are mesh, not fabric material
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 2 sizes and colors through Prime Wardrobe, however, I returned both and went with a different jacket. I LOVE the outer material and the colors of the Columbia jackets. Columbia always has nice products. And both fit well (the XL was just a bit too big). However, my drawback was the mesh pockets. These would have been an easy sell if the pockets were made of a regular material as opposed to open mesh. I put my keys in my pockets when I take the dog for a walk and the mesh just seemed like the key’s points would get tangled and tear the mesh
customer_reviews.author: That Girl

customer_reviews.title: Nice jacket
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t had the opportunity to use it yet but it is very nice and lightweight. I bought it a little loose to fit comfortably over clothes. I am 5’ and weigh 135lbs. I do have short arms so the sleeves were. A little long but not a problem for me.
customer_reviews.author: Jaime

customer_reviews.title: CAUTION: For people who are short...
customer_reviews.text: This jacket is actually pretty nice, but it's not perfect. This jacket mostly looks good closed due to the velcro lining the zippers. In addition, if you're not using to wearing nyon material, it may be a tad bit noisy for you. However, this jacket does has its good points! There's mesh lining on the inside of the jacket, and that includes its pockets. The pockets have zippers, adding security and they're really big! You can also make the parts around the arms, neck and hips tighter if you prefer to do so. Will write on update review once tested in SoCal rain :)
customer_reviews.author: Kristina Rae

customer_reviews.title: Durable and Protects Against Wind
customer_reviews.text: I was wary of purchasing this coat because it wasn't super expensive. I've worn it for 3 weeks and have been very pleased. I've been been working outdoors in blackberries, as well as tearing down a house. This coat protects me against the wind and rain, and has yet to tear. I normally wear a medium, so I ordered a medium. It was perfect for working in colder weather. I was able to fit a zip-up, long-sleeve, and a t-shirt underneath comfortably.
customer_reviews.author: SeahawkGal

customer_reviews.title: I like that the inside is mesh lined because it gets ...
customer_reviews.text: I've been out in the pouring rain in Florida while wearing this jacket and stayed dry. My phone survived zipped up in one of the front pockets too. I like that the inside is mesh lined because it gets so hot and muggy here, but this jacket is pretty lightweight. Therefore it gets 5 stars for meeting all of my expectations of a functional rain jacket.
customer_reviews.author: Leanna

customer_reviews.title: Great plus size rain jacket that zippers!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome! Finally found a jacket that fits me and zippers around my stomach as plus size! I am 5ft tall and the 3x was perfect. I typically wear 18/20 in Jean's and a 1x/2x in tops. The hips were a perfect fit with a bit of looseness around the chest, but the key is making sure it can zipper and it does! Very happy and would definitely recommend this for all the plus size ladies out there :)
customer_reviews.author: Fishcat1992

customer_reviews.title: Great rain jacket with good features
customer_reviews.text: I recently tried several Columbia jackets trying to find one that fit. This was the only one that fit perfectly. I usually wear a 2X but went with a 3X as it has more room to layer underneath. I like the adjustment at the sleeve and that its completely waterproof. I haven't had a chance to try it out in the rain yet but I'm sure it will work as expected. Great quality jacket--only improvement would be for it to have a lining other than mesh.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Church

customer_reviews.title: Great jacket for plus size women
customer_reviews.text: Plus size jackets/coats (clothing in general) that actually fit correctly are pain to find, which is why I was super excited about this jacket. I typically wear an 18-20 top and ordered a 2X jacket. It fits with room to spare. It's actually super warm as well since it doesn't breathe much. It can be rolled up to easily and compactly fit in my hiking pack. 10/10 recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Love this raincoat!
customer_reviews.text: I love this lightweight raincoat. The fuchsia color is beautiful. Originally I ordered a medium, which is my normal size and it was very fitted and looked great. However, I bought this coat to wear on an Alaskan cruise where I was told to wear many layers as the temperature changes. So in order to be able to wear sweaters or fleece under this coat, I ordered up to size large. My return was very easy. To my surprise when I returned the item, the new coat came the very next day!!
customer_reviews.author: MichelleH

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight
customer_reviews.text: It is lightweight, but still has a plastic feel. Also I'm a taller female 5'11, ended up going with a mens instead, more room in the shoulders and the arms are longer. This is better fit for someone 5'7 and below
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: High quality but not very breathable
customer_reviews.text: I love how this raincoat looks and it does a great job keeping me dry. Zipper pockets are always a plus. However, it isn't breathable at all and the mesh liner can be itchy, especially when it's warm or muggy outside. The small was too tight and the medium is a little bulky, but I opted for the larger size in case I ever need to wear a thicker shirt under it. Overall I am satisfied with the quality and appearance of the coat, but a little disappointed that the inner liner is mesh like and that it isn't a little more breathable.
customer_reviews.author: Gmahorselover

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase
customer_reviews.text: I was very hesitant to purchase this light weight jacket. I am 160lbs, 5'6 and busty up top. I was concerned since it was meant to be curvy, but fitted. My problem with jackets normally is being unable to get a good torso size, but also zip all the way. This blew my mind. I can comfortably zip all the way and look form fitted. My jacket also allows me to wear a light sweater underneath and still fit good.
customer_reviews.author: melody

customer_reviews.title: Works to keep the rain off you
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice windbreaker jacket and does the job of keeping the rain off as well as the cold at bay. I like that the cuffs has a velcro strap so u can adjust the sizing and looseness at the wrist. The jacker is 1 layer of some sort of plastic and an inner lining of a thin mesh. I would have liked it a bit more if the inside was lined with cotton. Overall, I still like it, it's functional and looks nice.
customer_reviews.author: Aili

customer_reviews.title: Great jacket
customer_reviews.text: I’m 5’7”, 180lbs and I got a large. It fits how I expected - not snug but not loose. It’s not too tight in the shoulders like some people said on Columbia’s website. I haven’t worn it in pouring rain yet (got it for a hiking trip to Colorado) but I will say it’s kept me perfectly dry walking my dogs in the rain and I love how the hood has little elastic bits that keep it on even when it’s really windy.
customer_reviews.author: today4ulove

customer_reviews.title: Love the Look!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this jacket in a Large, I normally wear a medium. I could've gotten the medium but for layering reasons I did not. I really like the style and honestly for this price, it's perfect for what I wanted it for! Keep in mind it is a rain jacket and this hits below my butt. The arms are a little long on me but I am 5'3 so I expected that. The Large is nice because I can throw a hoodie on under it for a little more warmth. Its thin, but it works in the wind for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Love this jacket!
customer_reviews.text: This jacket is really nice! After ready a ton of reviews I decided to go for it. I’ve been looking for a great lightweight rain jacket! A lot of reviews complained that the hood is too short, but I disagree, it’s the perfect size. The fit is perfect and the sleeves are not too long and not too short. The only real downfall is that the pockets are mesh, that worries me a little.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't be happier! Petite and Curvy fits me great!
customer_reviews.text: I am headed to Singapore and it is the beginning of their rainy season and needed a very light rain jacket and had only 3 days to find one and have it shipped, so my margin of error was null. I read so many reviews looking for the same size/build as me. I am 5'2" and about 135lbs with 40" DD and 40" hips, slimmer waist. The Medium fits perfect for this petite and curvy girl!!! The sleeves are not too long and the bottom of the jacket hits me right below my bum. I could layer under if I wanted with a light sweater or shirt and be just fine. This is going to be great in Indo-Pacific rain.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product from Columbia
customer_reviews.text: 5'4", 125 pounds and purchased a medium. It was definitely a little big, but wanted some room in case I needed to wear it over bulkier clothing. Brought this as a rain and wind jacket on a trip to Nepal. It was a life saver. Didn't encounter much rain but used it as a barrier for dust and wind and it worked well - the hood functions really nicely. It was also surprisingly warm. Priced well, great product!
customer_reviews.author: crb234

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I'm typically a size 8 and a medium fit me just fine. I bought the white because it was the cheapest color option and it looks pretty sharp. My hubby agrees. I'm 5'8" with long arms and broad shoulders (sometimes an issue for me with clothes) and I have plenty of room to move my arms comfortably. If I wanted to layer it, I'd have to size up for comfort, but it's fine for what I bought it for. I just wanted a light spring/fall jacket and something light I could take on day hikes. This fits the bill. Great price on Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Manders78

customer_reviews.title: It covers my behind!!
customer_reviews.text: Love the feel of it!! The mesh liner makes it breathe!! Has a good fit--- covers my behind. I did not anticipate that. I bought a white/white jacket. It's a pretty Snow White color... no Gray tinge as pictured on line. My sleeves are long enuf...and room in upper arm area still has room for a long sleeve and a thin sweater. But, because the fabric is sealed and wind proof, it's comfortable even with short sleeves and at 50 degrees outside.
customer_reviews.author: Lady Cravenshire

customer_reviews.title: Great waterproof thinner jacket
customer_reviews.text: Great coat that is actually waterproof, not just water resistant. Bought this for hiking trips in the future but this stood up to a walk in the pouring rain yesterday so it's good. It's definitely a thinner coat though -- I wore this to a football game in the pouring rain and wind and I felt the draft through the coat so be sure to layer if it's cold out (but hopefully this means it is breathable for summer months). Overall great product and fits as expected; I bought a size L, have a long torso and a larger bust and it fits great. Has adjustable cuffs and hood.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The measurement guide is not correct, bad experience.
customer_reviews.text: The measurement guide is not correct. The size is larger than in the official store. I could not return it before travel.
customer_reviews.author: Jose L Cascante

customer_reviews.title: Light Weight but Keeps You Dry
customer_reviews.text: I had been looking for a raincoat for some time. I work for a dog rescue in New Orleans and wanted something that would keep me dry during New Orleans downpours but also have ventilation since I am running around me sweating. This does the trick. It keeps me cool despite New Orleans heat and humidity but also keeps me dry when it is pouring. A must have
customer_reviews.author: Briana

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for layered protection.
customer_reviews.text: I'm 5'2", 115 pounds and ordered a small. I'm using this on a trip where I will be layering for warmth as well as rain. I was very impressed with the quality for the discounted price. It is a more baggy fit, but with layering that will work perfectly. If you want something more fitted, this may not be the right choice for you. Also, this jacket is not made for warmth on its own. It is very thin, but seems like it will work wonders when it comes to keeping you dry.
customer_reviews.author: Evelyn Moore

customer_reviews.title: Runs big
customer_reviews.text: Runs big. I normally wear a medium I ordered a small. Fits perfect. Water proof lightweight. Only issue is it’s very loud the material makes a lot of noise when you move or walk. I wanted this for work around my horses. It’s very loud for them. I’m 36 D chest ( small size worked ) Measurements 36-26-34. In ordered a small fits perfect
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: def works in light to medium rainfall
customer_reviews.text: have not tested yet in heavy rain but 100% works during light and medium rain. material is very lightweight, can barely notice you are wearing anything. when folded, can fit inside handbag. i usually wear medium shirts, but purchased a small and it was a perfect fit. arms of the jacket were on the long side, unless i have short arms
customer_reviews.author: Jas K

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit, looks like picture
customer_reviews.text: It's pretty thin, but that can be nice on summer days when it rains. I like that the pockets zip so I can put my phone in there and not worry about it falling out or getting wet. I'm 5'7 148lbs and ordered a medium. I'd say if you're any smaller than me than get a size smaller. It's a little big on me, but I don't like snug fitted jackets. My arms are long so finding sleeves long enough for me is always tough, but this jacket is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Shan

customer_reviews.title: Loud, both literally and figuratively.
customer_reviews.text: Seems a good quality product, well made and functional. I like the style. I’d go a size up if you intend to wear anything heavy under it. Two criticisms: 1 the material is loud. If you think you’re going to sneak up on an animal to get an awesome photo, forget it. Not happening. And 2. the color in the picture (geyser) is nothing like the bright teal jacket I received. If I thought I was going to be subtle in the rain-mist forest, I may as well forget it. Not happening.
customer_reviews.author: Laura P.

customer_reviews.title: 99 cent lettuce
customer_reviews.text: perfect for barefooted potato picking and late night grilling. Works best on full battery. Kneed dough to desired thickness and boom there it is. Cherokee hair tampons.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Thin
customer_reviews.text: I got a large, which was a little baggy (5'4", 165 lbs.). The jacket is very thin, so it makes a good rain jacket when it's not cold outside. It is definitely waterproof though!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Gross

customer_reviews.title: Not as long as I hoped
customer_reviews.text: I got this to replace my old one I left at the track. I loved the other one since it covered my butt. The other thing I don't like is that the zipper on the pocket is up when closed. The other one closed at the bottom. I do like this hood better. When you zip it up all the way it is closed. My old one you had to use those silly strings. This one has them also but the hood closes well with just zipping up.
customer_reviews.author: Trouble2

customer_reviews.title: It was perfect and I wore it everyday
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a spring trip to the UK. It was perfect and I wore it everyday! It kept out the wind and rain like a champ. On colder days I wore a Columbia fleece jacket underneath for extra warmth. I love this jacket so much and know I will wear it for years!
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Good Jacket
customer_reviews.text: Great jacket and will definitely be keeping it. I'm a bit curvy so it is a little snug on my hips when it's zipped all the way but it's not so snug that I feel it necessary to return. If you're undecided because of the mixed reviews I say go for it! If you're curvy, size up. I normally wear a size L (12-14) but for this jacket I bought a XL.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Super dry dog walking raincoat
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Needed a waterproof jacket to walk my dog. Anyone who has tried to walk dog, carry poopy bags and an umbrella understands. Bought it one size larger so I could wear warm sweaters under it. Fits great! Very dry and hood covers head well. Now I need to get my dog one in his size. Cherry red is super cute and visible. Why do people always wear black raincoats????
customer_reviews.author: rustydog

customer_reviews.title: Not for plus sizes.☹️
customer_reviews.text: Well made, but if you're a plus sized woman, size up. If you're over a size 20, order a men's jacket. Sadly the size chart isn't accurate for plus sizes. I'm an 18-20, and ordered a 2X which should be a 20-22. If you're an apple shape, this will be a snug fit. I'd say a 2X is closer to a true 18. This was a coat designed with smaller women in mind.
customer_reviews.author: ANGIEAUTIO-MOWRER

product_meta.title: Columbia Women's Arcadia Ii Waterproof Breathable Jacket With Packable Hood
product_meta.description: Waterproof, breathable, and packable, this rainy-day-MVP women's jacket is built to shield you from wet weather out on the trail and then stow away into a corner of your pack when the sun returns. An Omni-tech membrane combines with full seam sealing and a soft mesh lining to keep you dry and comfortable both on the exterior and interior.
feature_bullets: ADVANCED TECHNOLOGY: Columbia Women's Arcadia II Jacket features our signature, air-permeable protection that’s waterproof and breathable to shield you from drizzle to downpour.
ADJUSTABLE FEATURES: This shell top jacket features an adjustable storm hood, drawcord adjustable hem, and zippered hand pockets for ultimate comfort.
LIGHT & PACKABLE: The waterproof, lightweight design packs into your hand pocket for convenience on days when the weather is unpredictable.
DURABLE FABRIC: 100% nylon 2L fabric with a 100% polyester mesh lining keeps you warm, yet remains breathable.

OMNI-TECH: Our Omni-Tech technology features air-permeable protection that’s waterproof and breathable. It provides excellent waterproof protection, keeping mother nature's elements out, at the same time allowing the inside to breathe.
